results.title: A Chance to learn
results.creator_credit: Fred Moore, Leon Clore, British Productivity Council and Basic Films
results.brief_description: The advantages gained by industry from a systematic training of operators. A middle-aged woman, discontented because the personnel officer regards training as an expensive gimmick, takes another job where, given the chance to learn, her whole attitude changes. A small garment factory adopts a training program which becomes an indispensable part of normal activities.

results.title: A Chance for children
results.creator_credit: Michael Craven, UNICEF and Thomas Craven Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Shows how breast feeding, growth charts, oral rehydration therapy and immunization are successful in lowering child mortality and provide millions of children with an improved quality of life.

results.title: A Chance decision
results.creator_credit: Graham Goulding, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A chance decision led Graham Goulding into a teaching job in China where the banquets were endless and he and his colleagues were treated like royalty. A unique adventure that has remained with Goulding long after his return to Gippsland.

results.title: A Chance Affair
results.brief_description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: Chance makes a declaration to his best mate Jeff only to realise that what he thought was there can disappear just like smoke. Meanwhile, club diva Aviante sends a message to all the little wannabes out there who try and sing Whitney’s signature songs.

results.title: A Chairy tale
results.brief_description: This film depicts a young man and a chair (animated by Evelyn Lambart) that declines to be sat upon. The ensuing struggle, sometimes farcical, sometimes thoughtful, is an open-ended commentary on relationships. The technique used is pixilation. The musical accompaniment is by Ravi Shankar and Chatur Lal.

results.title: A Certified tractor
results.creator_credit: Robert Hesselschwerdt and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Shows the various methods of testing tractors by the Australian Tractor Testing Committee. Accurate measurement of belt and engine power, noise level at the driver’s ear and fuel consumption; pulling power; location of the centre of gravity; dismantling of engine and checking after 60 hours use; critical assessment of the general features.

results.title: A Century or the sack
results.creator_credit: Patricia Ludford, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: Looks at sheep shearing in Australia, and the contrasting outlooks of three shearers. A shearing contractor explains the conditions that today’s shearing gangs require, and shearers’ wives have their say. Filmed mainly in the Parkes district of New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Ludford, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: A century of responsible government [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Government of Victoria and Cine Service
results.brief_description: On 21st November, 1956, Victoria celebrated the centenary of responsible government in that State. To mark the occasion, the fortieth session of Parliament was formally opened by Sir Dallas Brookes, Governor of Victoria. At the ceremony Sir Dallas read a congratulatory message from the Queen and part of the speech made by Lieutenant McArthur when he opened the first Victorian Parliament in 1856. Also available on VHS [001846].

results.title: A Century of fantastic cinema: an interactive history of science fiction and horror films (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Eddie Munster (Butch Patrick) as he leads you on a fascinating tour of horror and science fiction films, starting from the early silent days and leading into the 1980’s. You can look through the poster gallery and see some great pictures and eerie sound and voice tracks; check out celebrity profiles; see what’s on at the theatre and peruse the souvenirs, all from the comfort of your own home.
